title: Jimmy Cayne, Who Led Bear Stearns Before It Imploded, Dies at 87
sub_head: Cayne, a blunt, competitive, cigar-smoking executive, loved to play bridge
body:
Jimmy Cayne, the bridge-playing chief executive who led Bear Stearns until it nearly collapsed in 2008, died Tuesday. He was 87.
Mr. Cayne became a poster child for financial mismanagement when the investment firm he had run since 1993 as Wall Streetâ€™s longest-serving CEO, toppled under a heavy debt load and trading losses. It was sold to JPMorgan Chase & Co . in a fire-sale deal backed by the U.S. government.
